• An endocentric compound is a type of compound word in which one element functions as the head, determining the grammatical category and core meaning of the entire compound, while the other element modifies the head.

    • Left Headedness: 攀高 (climb + high = climb up; rise). The compound '攀高' can be interpreted as 'to climb high', where the action of climbing is the main focus, and 'high' describes the extent or direction of the climbing action.

    • Right Headedness: 房型 (house + model = layout of a house). The compound '房型' can be interpreted as 'the layout or style of a house,' where the main focus is on the model or type, and 'house' provides additional information about what kind of model it is.

• An exocentric compound is a type of compound word in which neither element functions as the head, and the meaning of the compound is not directly related to the individual meanings of its elements.

    • Example 1: 花心: (attractive but unreal or insincere + heart = unfaithful). '花心' (huā xīn) is an exocentric compound because its meaning, 'unfaithful' or 'fickle,' cannot be directly derived from the individual meanings of its components, and the compound does not function as a hyponym of either element.

    • Example 2: 色狼: (lust + wolf = sex maniac). '色狼' (sè láng) is an exocentric compound because its meaning, 'sex maniac' or 'pervert,' is not directly derived from the individual meanings of its components, and the compound does not function as a hyponym of either element.
